channel.title: Code Too Large
channel.description:
Okay so i followed this tutorial to the T: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,437291.0.html When i compile my client i get this error message in the compiler. Class20.java:28: code too large public static void method257(int i, Class44 class 44)
and i was told to follow this tutorial: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,438121.0.html#post_toolarge
however its confusing and im unaware of what im to do!

item.title: Code Too Large
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:2, topic:343837”]The method is to big… You want to make a new method and paste half of the old method in it… Than in the first method your going to call on the second method. Keep in mind that anything that was defined in the old method has to be moved to the new method.

public static void method257(int i, Class44 class44) { for (int j = 0; j < FrameStart.length; j++) FrameStart[j] = 0; Class30_Sub2_Sub2 class30_sub2_sub2 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub2(class44 .method571("seq.dat", null), 891); anInt350 = class30_sub2_sub2.method410() + 3299; if (aClass20Array351 == null) aClass20Array351 = new Class20[anInt350]; for (int j = 0; j < anInt350; j++) { if (aClass20Array351[j] == null) aClass20Array351[j] = new Class20(); if (j < 3997) aClass20Array351[j].method259(true, class30_sub2_sub2); else setAnimBase(j);

That is the start of your old method.
below public static void method257(int i, Class44 class44) {
add

newMethod257(0, class44);

Than define that method

public static void newMethod257(int i, Class44 class44) { for (int j = 0; j < FrameStart.length; j++) FrameStart[j] = 0; Class30_Sub2_Sub2 class30_sub2_sub2 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub2(class44 .method571("seq.dat", null), 891); anInt350 = class30_sub2_sub2.method410() + 3299; if (aClass20Array351 == null) aClass20Array351 = new Class20[anInt350]; for (int j = 0; j < anInt350; j++) { if (aClass20Array351[j] == null) aClass20Array351[j] = new Class20(); if (j < 3997) aClass20Array351[j].method259(true, class30_sub2_sub2); else setAnimBase(j);

Than take half of the old method and paste it in the new method…[/quote]I feel like that is exactly what I said in a different topic…

Read full topic

item.description:
@eballer48 wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:2, topic:343837”]The method is to big… You want to make a new method and paste half of the old method in it… Than in the first method your going to call on the second method. Keep in mind that anything that was defined in the old method has to be moved to the new method.

public static void method257(int i, Class44 class44) { for (int j = 0; j < FrameStart.length; j++) FrameStart[j] = 0; Class30_Sub2_Sub2 class30_sub2_sub2 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub2(class44 .method571("seq.dat", null), 891); anInt350 = class30_sub2_sub2.method410() + 3299; if (aClass20Array351 == null) aClass20Array351 = new Class20[anInt350]; for (int j = 0; j < anInt350; j++) { if (aClass20Array351[j] == null) aClass20Array351[j] = new Class20(); if (j < 3997) aClass20Array351[j].method259(true, class30_sub2_sub2); else setAnimBase(j);

That is the start of your old method.
below public static void method257(int i, Class44 class44) {
add

newMethod257(0, class44);

Than define that method

public static void newMethod257(int i, Class44 class44) { for (int j = 0; j < FrameStart.length; j++) FrameStart[j] = 0; Class30_Sub2_Sub2 class30_sub2_sub2 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub2(class44 .method571("seq.dat", null), 891); anInt350 = class30_sub2_sub2.method410() + 3299; if (aClass20Array351 == null) aClass20Array351 = new Class20[anInt350]; for (int j = 0; j < anInt350; j++) { if (aClass20Array351[j] == null) aClass20Array351[j] = new Class20(); if (j < 3997) aClass20Array351[j].method259(true, class30_sub2_sub2); else setAnimBase(j);

Than take half of the old method and paste it in the new method…[/quote]
im about 1000 and 6 percent sure i cant do this.
sigh
i guess ill just have to now have skillcape emotes.
unless there is anyway you could maybe do this for me
on teamviewer? please? is there anyway you would?

item.title: Code Too Large
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

The method is to big… You want to make a new method and paste half of the old method in it… Than in the first method your going to call on the second method. Keep in mind that anything that was defined in the old method has to be moved to the new method.

public static void method257(int i, Class44 class44) { for (int j = 0; j < FrameStart.length; j++) FrameStart[j] = 0; Class30_Sub2_Sub2 class30_sub2_sub2 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub2(class44 .method571("seq.dat", null), 891); anInt350 = class30_sub2_sub2.method410() + 3299; if (aClass20Array351 == null) aClass20Array351 = new Class20[anInt350]; for (int j = 0; j < anInt350; j++) { if (aClass20Array351[j] == null) aClass20Array351[j] = new Class20(); if (j < 3997) aClass20Array351[j].method259(true, class30_sub2_sub2); else setAnimBase(j);

That is the start of your old method.
below public static void method257(int i, Class44 class44) {
add

newMethod257(0, class44);

Than define that method

public static void newMethod257(int i, Class44 class44) { for (int j = 0; j < FrameStart.length; j++) FrameStart[j] = 0; Class30_Sub2_Sub2 class30_sub2_sub2 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub2(class44 .method571("seq.dat", null), 891); anInt350 = class30_sub2_sub2.method410() + 3299; if (aClass20Array351 == null) aClass20Array351 = new Class20[anInt350]; for (int j = 0; j < anInt350; j++) { if (aClass20Array351[j] == null) aClass20Array351[j] = new Class20(); if (j < 3997) aClass20Array351[j].method259(true, class30_sub2_sub2); else setAnimBase(j);

Than take half of the old method and paste it in the new method…

Read full topic
